Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice Royal fans have suggested Prince Charlesapos birthday wishes for his grandson Archie could be an olive branch to Harry following the Sussexesapos explosive interview with Oprah.Charles and we Camilla shared a black and white photo, taken by fashion photographer Chris Allerton, of Harry proudly showing Archie off to the child’s proud grandfather at his christening in July .It was the last time Charles and Archie were officially photographed together. Meghan Markle is not in the photo, leaving some fans wondering why she wasnapost included.The caption stated: Happy birthday to Archie, who turns two today.Royal fans suggested the move could have been a small step towards healing the rt between Harry and his family, as Charles and Camillaaposs Instagram account did not have any posts when Princess Charlotte turned six and Prince Louis turned three recently.Others saw it as a snub to Archieaposs mum Meghan, who is pregnant with a baby girl, and some said there should have been similar posts for Charlotte and Louis. Charles and Camillaaposs Twitter account retweeted a post from the Royal Family on Charlotteaposs birthday on May , adding the caption: Happy Birthday to Princess Charlotte, who turns six today! It retweeted a post from Prince William and Kate Middleton on Louisapos birthday on April , with the caption: A very Happy Birthday to Prince Louis, who turns three today. Charles and Camillaaposs Twitter account did the same when William and Kate celebrated their tenth wedding anniversary last month. Keep up to date with all the latest news from the Queen, Charles, William, Kate, Harry, Meghan, George, Charlotte, Louis, Archie and the rest of the family. Weaposll send the best Royal news directly to your inbox so you never have to miss a thing.to our newsletter here. As social media users suggested the birthday wishes to Archie were a gesture of goodwill, one fan wrote: Youaposre all class, Charles, under very trying circumstances. Another Instagram user wrote: Is somebody maybe trying to appease Harry and his we  Some left comments asking why Charles and Camilla didnapost share a photo that included Meghan. One wrote: Whereaposs Meghan in the shot  Others wondered by the Instagram account didnapost share similar posts for Charlotte and Louis, like it has in previous years. One user wrote: Wow, disappointing that there wasn’t a dedicated post for Louis and Charlotte recently. It is thought Charles hasnapost seen Archie - one of his four grandchildren - in person for at least  months. The Sussexes moved to Canada in late  and then to Los Angeles as they quit their roles as senior royals. Harry ed to the UK for his grandfather Prince Philipaposs funeral last month, his first trip home since the coupleaposs sht away from public le and their bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey. Harry told Oprah that his dad had stopped taking his calls for a period of time, but they were speaking again. It is said that Charles briefly spoke to his sons after Philipaposs funeral. As they celebrated Archieaposs birthday on Thursday, Harry and Meghan asked fans wanting to mark the occasion to donate money to pay for Covid vaccinations in disadvantaged countries. The couple thanked those who offered “warmth and support” for their family and said the gestures had left them “deeply touched”.

title: child 5 stuck india parents
story: :root Child, , stuck in India while parents are in Australia amid strict Covid rulesLittle Johannah has not seen her parents Drisya and Dilin since November  and it is not clear when they will be able to reunite. Her parents are trying to repatriate her from India back to AustraliaChild, , stuck in India while parents are in Australia amid strict Covid rulesLittle Johannah has not seen her parents Drisya and Dilin since November  and it is not clear when they will be able to reunite. Her parents are trying to repatriate her from India back to AustraliaDrisya and Dilin have not been able to see their daughter Johannah since November Image: DRISYA AND DILIN WSByChiara Fiorillo:,  May  A five-year-old girl is stuck in India while her parents are in Australia and they have not been able to see each other for one year and a half due to strict coronavirus restrictions.Little Johannah has not seen her parents Drisya and Dilin since November  and it is not clear when they will be able to reunite. The young girl is one of at least  children who are stuck in India and are trying toto Australia. Johannah was staying with her grandparents when the pandemic hit and was not able tohome to her parents due to border closures. Drisya and Dilin tried to get her on government-organised flights, but have not been able to bring her home yet because children younger than  are not allowed to travel alone on the repatriation trips. When Johannahaposs parents found a flight to bring her home through a private company, they were hoping her daughter could travel from Bangalore to Sydney yesterday. However, that flight was cancelled after the Australian government brought in a ban on all arrivals from India.Dilin told the BBC : It was our last hope, we have exhausted all options.We literally fell apart. Sometimes you get a ray of hope, but then thereaposs a set back like this. Dilin and Drisya also told their story to an Australian Senate committee which is investigating the governmentaposs effort to bring stranded citizens back home. The heartbroken dad told the Committee: We have not seen [our daughter] grow. When her grandma says she has grown, I feel sad. Lynette Wood from the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade said officials knew of  children who were outside of their family group – that is they are on their own – who are seeking toto Australia.  Many children, like Johannah, had been staying with their grandparents before the pandemic struck.One of the children is -months-old Ziva Narang, who has not seen her mum Muneet for over a year, ABC reports.The woman said: Every time I see her on the video cam, I feel like crying, but I canapost cry in front of my own parents - it makes them so disheartened.With so much changing so quickly, keep on top of what is happening with the Mirroraposs news updates by email. Delivered straight to your inbox, our daily coronavirus briefing will keep you informed of what is happening with Covid, lockdown, the vaccination rollout and the impact on how we live.here. Ms Narang travelled to India with her two daughters in January last year and ed to Australia with her elder daughter in March. Little Ziva was due towith her grandmother but then borders closed. Muneet said: We never imagined that this lockdown would last for so long. People are really struggling to get flights, people are really struggling to survive, people donapost know how to live without their loved ones. India has been fighting a devastating coronavirus outbreak, with millions of people getting infected and thousands dying every week. In the past week alone, the country recorded . million new infections.

title: delivery mans rapid covid test
story: AdvertorialDelivery mans rapid Covid test outside hospice could have saved livesRegular rapid testing at home is a quick and easy way to help stop the spread of Covid- and protect the people around youmirrorShareByLaura Tait:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY AdvertorialRegular testing now seen as vital to stop the spread of Covid-Alex had no symptoms when he tested positive for Covid- back in February. Around a third of people with coronavirus show no symptoms, so can infect others without even knowing they’ve been ill. Rapid testing is a vital tool to make sure people know when to self isolate so they break the chain of transmission. Alex, , from Hemel Hempstead, works for JamVans, a removal company that provides Covid- tests for its employees. He was experiencing no symptoms at all when he tested positive for Covid. “We move people’s homes on a daily basis, and also have a delivery contract with a local hospice – it has about  charity stores, and we help them move all the stock,” says Alex. “One morning before work I did a rapid Covid- test outside the hospice, then sat in my van waiting for the results. I’d done a few of these tests, and thought it would be fine as I didn’t have a single symptom – but then the test came back positive.”  “I spoke to the hospice on the phone from outside the building, and they told me I had to go for a PCR test. My company booked me in with a private firm and I went straight there. Our company policy is that we have to wear a mask in people’s houses and throughout our offices, and I stick to the guidelines as much as I can, so at first I thought the rapid flow test must be wrong. But within an hour, I was told I definitely had Covid. I couldn’t quite believe it.” Alex was able to isolate straightaway, ensuring he wasn’t spreading Covid to any vulnerable people he came into contact with. “I stopped working to self-isolate on full pay, and still didn’t develop any symptoms at all,” he says. “Without the test, I definitely would have carried on working, which is why it’s so important to have regular tests, evenyou haven’t got any symptoms. I had the virus and I felt fine, but imagineI’d given it to my parents, my grandparents or my colleagues  “If I’m driving between  charity shops, with three or four people in each shop, I could have been quite a spreader. I would have put a lot of people at risk, who may not be as young and healthy as I am – you never know who you’re passing it on to. It might sound dramatic, but in my case, taking the test could have saved lives. I haven’t had the jab yet, but I will as soon as I can – and I’ll still be taking two tests a week.Get into the testing habit More than half the adults in the UK have had at least one dose of Covid vaccination and lockdown restrictions are beginning to ease. But the virus is still out there and around a third of all the people who are infected do not show any symptoms. Regular rapid testing is vital to break the chain of transmission – now all adults are advised to do two tests a week. Rapid testing kits are free and you can do them at home, with results appearing within just  minutes. If you test positive, you’ll be able to isolate straightaway rather than risk spreading Covid to others. Millions of people have already made regular home testing part of their routine, as secondary school children and their parents have been able get free tests since February, but now everyone is encouraged to play their part. Every test helps to put your mind at rest and helps protect people around you as the country moves out of lockdown. Around one in three people with coronavirus has no symptoms. Rapid Covid-tests are for people who aren’t showing symptoms. If you’re showing symptoms , order a PCR test. Test twice a week, or every three or four days: it’s the best way to catch a case of Covid- at the point it becomes highly infectious.If you test positive you should self-isolate immediately and visit nhs.uk get-tested or call  to order a PCR test that will confirm the result.If you test negative, you must still follow the Hands, Face, Space and Fresh Air rules to minimise the spread of Covid-. Rapid tests are easy to use and give results within  minutes. It’s important to report your results online straightaway, whether the test is positive, negative or even void. It’s easy to do at gov.uk report-covid-result or by calling .More than m rapid tests have been taken since October , and hundreds of thousands of positive cases among people with no symptoms have been picked up. Information from the rapid tests is kept anonymous, and scientists use it to spot patterns and outbreaks more quickly and accurately, helping to reduce the risk of future lockdowns. Even though you might have already had one or two doses of vaccine, there’s a chance you could still give Covid to someone , as no vaccine is  per cent effective. So it’s vital to test twice weekly as well as continuing to follow social distancing guidance, washing hands, wearing a face covering and letting fresh air in. Rapid Covid- tests are suitableyou have no symptoms of Covid .“Remember, around a third of people with coronavirus have no symptoms, but could be spreading it to others without knowing,” says GP Dr Amir Khan. “Rapid testing is effective at detecting people who are infectious and enabling us to find Covid- cases that we otherwise would not know about. This helps us in our efforts to stop the spread of the virus. Testing regularly even when you have no symptoms means we can keep infection levels low and our country safe, and the good thing is they give a result within  minutes.” And, as Dr Khan notes, the tests are very reliableyou do them correctly. “Testing ourselves for coronavirus using rapid Covid- tests is vital in keeping ourselves and others safe from coronavirus and keeping infection rates in our communities low. When done correctly, the tests are at least . per cent specic, which means the risk of  positives is extremely low – less than one in a thousand. This means it is a very good test.”‘All I had was a mild sore throat’ Kim Tobin, from Southend, Essex, works in a supermarket and had a positive Covid- test in January  Routine rapid testing in the workplace helped Kim, , discover she had Covid, even though she was showing no symptoms. Without the test, she could have spread it to her workmates and customers.“I had a very, very mild sore throat, just a little scratch and that was it,” she says. “I didn’t even think anything of it. I was all dressed for work, ready to go. Then I went and had the test, and after  minutes the lady who had done it came up to me and said, ‘You need to go home right now because you’ve got it – you’ve tested positive.’”

title: family reuniting after year facetime
story: NewsopinionFamily reuniting after year of FaceTime felt better than  Christmas Days put togetherThe warm and wise words of Mrs Savage - Robbies mum. This week Val reflects on a family get together after a year of chats on FaceTime and the doorstep - and how the Line of Duty finale left her feeling let downmirrorShareCommentsByVal Savage:,  MAY NewsopinionVal with Robbie’s sons Charlie, left, and Freddie " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeMaking a meal of being with family for Charlieaposs th. There are certain times in le when I like to sit back, stay quiet and really drink in a moment. That came on Sunday when, after over a year of chats over a doorstep or FaceTime, I was finally reunited with both my sons, their fabulous wives and my three grandchildren. I never need to be reminded how much family means – I love the bones of all them and would take a bullet for each of them. But when worrying times and restrictions have kept us apart, being together meant more than ever. So I stole a few minutes during my eldest grandson Charlie’s th birthday lunch at the weekend to pinch myself. Aren’t we all so lucky to be here  I even appreciated the journey to the restaurant. The sights of the motorway used to bore me as I spent so long on them during Robert’s playing days. What is your view  Have your say in the comment section But since I hadn’t been on one for almost two years, I loved staring out of the spray on the windows at other cars whizzing by, road signs and wind turbines. I tried directing Jonathan but in the end he said he preferred to use the satnav as I don’t say left or right, just “this way and that way” while waving my arms around. For months I’ve pined for a restaurant meal, dreaming of a menu full of food I hadn’t bought or prepared myself and being served a surprise. The meal was delicious. I even pretended I had a dog when I asked our lovely waitress to put my pork crackling leftovers in a box to take home. I think she knew it was for me rather than an imaginary Rover because she nipped into the kitchen and filled a box to the very top for me. She could see I had trouble walking so on the way out she helped me through the kitchen as a shortcut. When I met the chef his face fell when I said: “Excuse me, I’d like to talk to you about your gravy.” But it was just to tell him it was so wonderful I hoped he’d have a bottle I could take home. When people go above and beyond to make you comfortable and happy, they deserve credit. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  So I want to say thank you again to fantastic waitress Joanne Long. You were so lovely to me and all my family But in the end, it wouldn’t have matteredwe’d been served Spam on stale bread. We were together and that’s all that mattered. My best memories are not of the most beautul places I’ve visited or the tastiest plates I’ve polished off. They are all based on people around me and how they make me feel. Being with my family after so long gave me a warm, comforting mix of joy, wonder, extreme love and endless gratitude. It felt better than five Christmas Days put together. Laughter helps to stop sadness Throughout Charlie’s birthday celebrations, news that Robert’s French bulldog Coco was ill hung over us like a cloud. I could feel it after lunch when we went back to his house for champagne . Robert had come straight from the vet’s and I could see his eyes were down at his cheeks as he’d been crying. Charlie was so good at making sure he talked to everyone but he kept looking over at his dad because he knew he was sad. People who have never had a dog mightn’t realise they become part of the family. They have so much love to give and ask for nothing. Coco has a problem with her spine and cannot come home from the vet’s until she is strong enough to walk.  Robert’s we Sarah was doing a great job of trying to keep everyone happy but I could see poorly Coco was on all our minds. In our family we can only feel sentimental for so long before we have to laugh again. It’s our way of coping. So I sneaked off into my grandson’s room, put on a pair of dark glasses and a baseball cap then burst back into the living room and shouted, “Let’s get this party started!” Then I began rapping.I don’t think that Charlie will forgethis th.Give us a Twirl: I’m a chocoholic  I love my grandson. But I also love chocolate. So don’t think bad of me for eating Charlie’s Easter Egg. It had been in my cupboard for far too long, beckoning, winking and whispering to me. One minute I was telling my friends I didn’t want any cakes or treats because I was trying to be healthy, the next I was ripping off the paper on Charlie’s egg and eating the lot. Within minutes, one big egg and two Twirl bars disappeared. And I enjoyed it. I felt no qualms about it. Even when I had to get down on the floor to wipe up the bits of chocolate I’d stepped in, I didn’t regret a single bite. I’ve done my Duty, guys  Each day of the run-up to the Line of Duty finale felt so exciting. The BBC did a great job of building it up. I loved the idea of the nation all tuning in at the same time like the old days before smarty-pants TVs. But I was disappointed. It was like watching an FA Cup Final, when you think about it all day, get settled in for the match... and the game is boring. If there is another series, I won’t be watching. I can’t cope with all the emotions. Why Robert backs kit for kids  No wonder Robert backs the Mirror’s campaign to help fund kids’ grassroots football kits. He remembers how much it meant to him as a child and how many sacrices we made to help him have the boots and kit he always needed. Robert now runs his own youth football team, just as my late husband Colin did when he was young. I washed the team kit and helped prepare food and drinks for supporters but Colin did everything – from setting up the goal posts to being the coach, manager and ref whenever the ref didn’t turn up.Starting this Saturday: Get FREE kits for your local grassroots football team. See Saturday’s Daily Mirror for full details on how to register! Some parents behaved worse than the kids. I wasn’t there the time a mum from our own team, furious that her son was sent off, slapped Colin in the face. If anyone hit my family these days, they’d get a walking stick where the sun don’t shine. We weathered storm but the rain carries on  Colin and I used to call my mum Michael Fish because she could predict rain with astonishing accuracy. It could be the most beautul sunny day and she would say: “Rain’s on the way. I can feel it in my back.” She was never wrong.But I wonderMum’s bones would even be surprised to see such awful weather in May. Just as we’re all starting to go out, rain is keeping us in. Isn’t that so British  Still, I wouldn’t live anywhere  in the world. Andwe wake up in the morning to hail, rain or snow, it’s a good day because we’re alive. How did we manage

territories that will be on a travel aposgreen listapos when overseas holidays are allowed again from May . Portugal, including Madeira and the Azores, Israel, Iceland, Gibraltar, Australia, New Zealand, Brunei, Singapore, Faroe Islands and the Falkland Islands are on the green list, Transport Secretary Grant Shapps confirmed at a Downing Street press conference. Travellers to these countries will not have to quarantine on theirto the UK. But anyone who travels to red list countries such as India, South Africa and, from May , Turkey, Males and Nepal, will be forced to stay in a hotel at their own expense. Mr Shapps also asked Cha and Manchester City fans not to travel to Istanbul for the Champions League final on May , and said the government were open to hosting the match in this country.Most of Europe, including Spain, France, Greece and Italy, is designated amber, so people who travel there will be expected to quarantine at home when they .We will bring you live updates and information about travel rules and restrictions as itaposs confirmed below. Key EventsBritish Airways puts on extra flights to Portugal after green list announcement:Here are  destinations now on Englands green list:Portugal, Gibraltar and Israel among  countries exempt from self-isolation rules, officials confirm:Government plans to play it safe with small list of green countries:All the countries expected to be included on the green list::Matthew DreschWhat happensa green list country becomes amber  Your key holiday questions answeredIf you#xve booked a holiday and a destination becomes amber, you should still be able to go - but you#xll need to self-isolate at home when you .The government has said it will offer a green #xwatchlist#x to offer some warning that a country could go amber.But of course, self-isolating at home doesn#xt work for everyone - and the good news is that most travel firms are offering quite a fair bit of flexibility around this for bookings.For example, TUI lets you amend a trip for freea green destination goes on the watchlist or amber list, and same for an amber destination becoming red. Meanwhile, Thomas Cook has said thata destination is amber, you can also change your holiday for free.Click here for answers to your key holiday questions.:Matthew DreschTUI, Jet, easyJet and Ryanair’s UK travel updates as green list announcedHolidaymakers can finally start planning trips abroad again!Firms such as TUI, Jet, easyJet, Ryanair and British Airways are gearing up to restart trade.Ahead of the green list announcement, TUI said it would be contacting customers directlythey have a holiday booked which is impacted by the changes. It said it would contact customers in departure date order to discuss their options.Click here to read the full story on how firms have reacted to the news. :Matthew DreschMajor additions needed for green list, airlines industry body saysThe Government must make major additions to its green list of travel destinations at the next review point in three weeks, the boss of Airlines UK has said.Tim Alderslade, chief executive of the industry body which represents UK carriers, said: This is a missed opportunity and, with so few countries making it onto the green list, represents a reopening of air travel in name only.By contrast, the EU has said vaccinated people will be able to travel without restrictions, which leaves the UK at risk of falling behind and not opening up international travel to key markets across Europe as well as the United States.We strongly believe that, alongside the domestic economy, travel can be safely reopened and so we must see major additions to the green list at the next review point in three weeks, alongside a simpler and much-reduced testing burden so that travel does not become the preserve of the wealthy only.:Matthew DreschJust four countries on UK travel green list will let Brits in without quarantiningJust four countries on the governmentaposs newly-unveiled aposgreenapos travel list will allow Brits to holiday without quarantining. This evening it was announced that  countries and territories have made the list, including Portugal, Israel, Gibraltar, Australia and New Zealand. Also included were Singapore, Brunei, Iceland, the Faroe Islands and the Falkland Islands, alongside the Azores and Madeira territories in Portugal.But before excited tourists packing their bags and book a flight, itaposs important to note that heading to some of these destinations will mean they must spend the first few days of their trip isolating - and some will not let them in at all.Only Portugal, including the Azores and Madeira, and Gibraltar are open to Brits without quarantining - with Iceland and Israel also not enforcing isolation but requiring holidaymakers to be vaccinated.Click here to read the full story.:Matthew DreschTravel rules expected to be broadly similar across England, Scotland, Wales and Northern IrelandOverseas travel rules are expected to be broadly similar in design across England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, the Transport Secretary has said.Grant Shapps told a Downing Street press conference that he had spoken with the devolved administrations and that Englandaposs traffic light system had been created with their agreement.Quarantine and coronavirus testing requirements for people arriving in England from May  - when foreign holidays are permitted - will be based on the new system, with destinations placed on green, amber and red lists.Mr Shapps said: All of the four chief medical officers of the Joint Bio Security Centre have met and agreed the principles that sit behind the traffic light system, so there is a large degree of agreement and co-operation in developing the system.:Matthew DreschEasyJet boss calls on Government for clarity over future green list countriesEasyJet boss Johan Lundgren has called on the Government to provide clarity about which countries could be added to its green travel list.Mr Lundgren said in a statement: The decision to put so few European countries into the green tier is simply not justied by the data or the science and is inconsistent with the approach to reopen the domestic economy.He added: So, we call on Government to provide transparency on decision-making and clarity on when we can expect other European countries to join the green list so that consumers and airlines alike can plan for this summer.In the meantime, they must drive down the cost of testing and review, and remove testing for green, low-risk countries. Green really should mean green.He said easyJet will be increasing its flights to green-list destinations and launching new routes where possible.:Matthew DreschBenidorm mayor begs UK Government to let Brits backBenidormaposs mayor is calling on the UK Government to give the resort green traffic light status, saying it is the place of happiness for the Brits.A disappointed Toni P#xErez says Benidorm has better data than Portugal, the Canary Islands and the Balearic Islands and British holidaymakers should be allowed to travel without going into quarantine on their .In view of the accumulated incidence, Benidorm meets the criteria to be green in that traffic light system, he said.The Mayor added: The latest data available from the Spanish health authorities position the Valencian community as the region with the best control of the epidemiological situation. The data for the province of Alicante and Benidorm in particular are highly satisfactory.The cumulative incidence at  days per , inhabitants in the Valencian Community is . cases, while the general incidence of the province of Alicante and Benidorm is six points lower. And compared to the destinations announced in the last hours, Benidorm has better AI data than Portugal , the Canary Islandsor the Balearic Islands .He has slammed the decision not to put Spain on the green list as incomprehensible and wants to personally inform the British ambassador of the reality of the Benidorm tourist destination in which the British market accounts for % of the tourist demand for the city.The mayor said Benidorm had carried out great work to combat the pandemic, closing its beaches and hotels in March , eight days before the recommendation of the Spanish Government and had organised the repatriation operation of more than , Britons to preserve them from the incidence of Covid- .:Matthew DreschWhat are your thoughts on the new traffic light travel system  Are you a fan of the Governmentaposs new apostraffic lightapos travel system or do you have concerns Please fill out our survey below to let us know your thoughts.:Matthew DreschRyanair offers , extra flight seats to PortugalRyanair is offering , extra flight seats to Portugal after the Governementaposs announcement.Ryanair#xs Director of Marketing, Dara Brady, said:#xCWe are very pleased to announce , extra seats to Portugal on the back of the UK#xs green list. With quarantine-free travel now permitted to the likes of Faro, Lisbon and Porto, even more flights have been added to our UK schedule in order to meet the demand from our customers.The UK Summer  schedule comprises  destinations, having recently launched  new routes and with more to be added as restrictions relax throughout Europe over the summer months. UK families can book a well-earned summer holiday safe in the knowledge thattheir plans change, they can move their travel dates up to two times with a zero-change fee up until the end of October .Ryanair is offering , extra flight seats to Portugal :Matthew DreschHolidaymakers urged to book holiday with a refund policyGrant Shapps said travellers should not book holidays that do not include a refund policythe countryaposs Covid situation changes.The Transport Secretary told a Downing Street press conference on Friday: Green list countries will be placed on a watch list.If we start to have any concerns, andit is necessary because of a new upswing in cases or a new iant, we will not hesitate to act fast and withdraw green status.He added: Our strong advice is not to book any holiday which does not include a refund in the event that the Covid-related situation changes and youaposre able to cancel.Iaposm afraid we do expect longer delays at airports. :Matthew DreschGovernments travel list plan is slower than expected and will delay recovery The Governmentaposs approach to resuming international travel will delay the industryaposs recovery, according to the chief executive of travel trade organisation ABTA.Mark Tanzer said: Although it was good to hear the ministersay he wants people to be able to travel this summer, this is a slower and more cautious approach than previously outlined by the Government and will delay the industryaposs recovery.We understand that public health is the Governmentaposs priority, and it was always expected that theto international travel would be gradual, but the Government must use the next review to open up travel to more destinations, using the traffic light system to manage risk.We also need the Government to commit to supporting travel agents and tour operators through what will continue to be dficult times ahead.Travel will be one of the most restricted economic sectors coming out of the pandemic and this needs to be recognised through adequate grants to support these businesses.:KEY EVENTBritish Airways puts on extra flights to Portugal after green list announcementBritish Airways said it would be laying on additional flights to Portugal following the announcement that foreign travel can resume to some destinations.However, the airline added it was disappointed with restrictions for amber countries.Chairman and CEO Sean Doyle said: Weaposre pleased that our customers are able to start travelling again to some countries, including Portugal.Weaposve put on additional flights from London, Manchester, Newcastle and Edinburgh to Faro to help people get moving.Whataposs clear is that with high levels of vaccination in the UK being matched by other countries, we should see more destinations going aposgreenapos before the end of June.Itaposs disappointing to hear that despite the stringent safeguards introduced for travel from aposamber listapos countries, the Government is now suggesting travellers avoid these.We cannot stress more greatly that the UK urgently needs travel between it and other low-risk countries, like the US, to restart the economy, support devastated industries and reunite loved ones. :Matthew DreschTravel list was not based on where people want to lie on beachesGrant Shapps said the travel list was not created based on where people want to lie on beaches.He told a Downing Street press conference: This is not a list generated and created to think about where people want to lie on beaches and then twist the science to fit it. That would be completely wrong.It would go against everything we have said. In fact, it would betray what everyone has gone through for the past year.Mr Shapps added: What we can and will do, though, is review the list very regularly.He said other countries need the chance to catch up in regard to reducing Covid- cases, adding: Some of those places are the locations where people want to go on holiday.Askedmass travel will resume this year to popular destinations, Mr Shapps said: I think we will gradually see an opening up.:Matthew DreschBorder force taking five to  minutes to check each passenger arriving in UKBorder force chief Paul Lincoln said it was taking on average five to  minutes to check each passenger arriving into the UK.For the time being, passengers will need to accept an increase in the time taken at each stage of their journey, he told a press conference.It currently takes a Border Force officer five to  minutes to complete all the necessary checks. means that even for the most compliant passenger, it might take  or  times longer to process than before, compared to around  seconds.Where people do not have the correct paperwork it can and has taken considerably longer, including when we need to serve fixed penalty notices for non-compliance.Mr Lincoln added the Border Force was still under instruction from ministers to check % of passengers.However he said it would be making some paperwork digital, such as the passenger locator form, in a bid to speed up the process, while more staff would be made available to carry out checks. :Matthew DreschRemoval of travel restrictions necessarily cautiousTransport Secretary Grant Shapps said the removal of international travel restrictions on May  was necessarily cautious.He told a Downing Street press conference on Friday that the Government must make absolutely sure the countries the UK reconnects with are safe.He said: We in this country have managed to construct a fortress against Covid. But the disease is still prevalent in other parts of the world, most notably at the moment in India.In fact, more new cases of Covid have been diagnosed around the world in the last seven days than at any time since the pandemic began.He added: Thataposs why todayaposs announcement, removing the stay in the UK restrictions from May , is necessarily cautious.We must make absolutely sure that the countries we reconnect with are safe, that their infection rates are low and their vaccination rates are high.It means making sure we are not incubating the most dangerous iants that theyaposre not and that they have safe and secure surveillance in place.:Abigail OLearyBrits think everyone should go into hotel quarantine when travel restartsFamilies desperate for a sunshine holiday should finally learn which destinations are ranked green, amber or red for travel on Friday #x as seven out of  Britons back forcing all passengers into hotel quarantine when they .People are so scared about importing vaccine-resistant coronavirus iants that they support sending arrivals from all foreign countries straight to self-isolation at Government-approved facilities, according to a poll.The study comes as Transport Secretary Grant Shapps is due to unveil the #xCtraffic light#xD regime, grading countries#x risk for non-essential overseas travel from May .Passengers ing from red countries will have to quarantine at Government-sanctioned hotels.Those coming back from amber nations must self-isolate at home for  days.Read more on this story hereBritain could open up separate travel corridors for some of the Greek and Spanish islands:Abigail OLearyWarning over trips without refund policiesGrant Shapps said travellers should not book holidays that do not include a refund policythe countryaposs Covid situation changes.The Transport Secretary told a Downing Street press conference on Friday: Green list countries will be placed on a watch list.If we start to have any concerns, andit is necessary because of a new upswing in cases or a new iant, we will not hesitate to act fast and withdraw green status.He added: Our strong advice is not to book any holiday which does not include a refund in the event that the Covid-related situation changes and youaposre able to cancel.Iaposm afraid we do expect longer delays at airports.:Matthew DreschFootball fans should not travel to Turkey for Champions League finalFootball fans should not travel to Turkey for the Champions League final after it was placed on the Governmentaposs travel aposred listapos. Manchester City and Cha are set to play at the Ataturk Stadium in Istanbul on May .However Transport Secretary Grant Shapps today said fans should not travel to Turkey for the match. :Matthew DreschPassengers should expect delays at borders due to Covid checksHolidaymakers face delays at border control upon theirto England.Speaking at todayaposs Downing Street press briefing, Border Force chief Paul Lincoln said: Passengers should still expect time at the borders to take longer as we conduct the checks that the public rightly expect during this global pandemic.:KEY EVENTHere are  destinations now on Englands green listPortugal including the Azores and MadeiraAustraliaNew ZealandSingaporeBruneiIcelandFaroe IslandsGibraltarFalkland IslandsIsrael:Matthew DreschFrance, Spain and fortress built at such a huge cost to all of us secure.... for now we must tread carefully, respecting the science that will guide us along the way.:Matthew DreschTurkey, Males and Nepal added to travel red listTurkey, the Males and Nepal have been added to Englandaposs travel aposred listapos.This means that any Brits ing from these countries after am on Wednesday will have to quarantine in a hotel at a cost of #xA,.The Department for Transport also announced that from May , people who have had both doses of a coronavirus vaccine will be able to use the NHS app to demonstrate their status.:KEY EVENTPortugal, Gibraltar and Israel among  countries exempt from self-isolation rules, officials confirmPortugal, Gibraltar and Israel are among  countries and territories people inEngland can visit from May  without self-isolating on their , theDepartment for Transport said.:Matthew DreschTest kits to be sold for £ in summer package holiday driveTUI has announced that it will offer test kits from #xApp for anyone on its package holidays this summer, which will include both lateral flow antigen and PCR tests.When foreign holidays restart from the UK - May  being the earliest date - countries will be placed on green, amber and red lists, each with their own testing and quarantine requirements. For green destinations youaposll need to take a PCR test back in the UK, while multiple tests will be required for those ing from amber and red destinations.With some PCR tests starting from #xA each, those costs can quickly add up and leave families forking out over #xA extra for holidays.TUI has teamed up with Chronomics to offer its cheaper tests, which will include the delivery andcosts of the kits.Click here to read the full story. :Dave BurkeGrant Shapps hosts G talks on how to restart international travelTransport Secretary Grant Shapps has hosted G talks aimed at creating a robust, accessible and coordinated approach to restarting international travel.The Cabinet minister held a virtual meeting with his counterparts from the US, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan and the EU Commission to identy common goals and principles in the development of globally recognised travel standards, according to the Department for Transport.This includes best practices for sharing scientic data and coordinating on universally recognised travel certicates.Mr Shapps said: If weaposre to safely and sustainably restart international travel on a global scale we need a robust, accessible and coordinated approach.Thataposs why Iaposve brought together my G counterparts to identy shared goals, address challenges we may face and progress work on a coordinated approach that will allow us to build back better as we look to the future. :Dave BurkeHow will categories be decided Destinations will be categorised based on a range of factors, including the proportion of a countryaposs population that has been vaccinated, rates of infection, emerging new iants, and the countryaposs access to reliable scientic data and genomic sequencing.Luis Gallego, chief executive of British Airwaysapos parent company IAG, urged the Government to be a bit ambitious in getting global travel back on track.He wants people who have been vaccinated or tested to be allowed to fly without restrictions between the UK and the US.The airline said it will launch a new advertising campaign on Friday featuring staff who are preparing toto work after a very dficult year.No plans for the resumption of foreign holidays have been announced by the UKaposs devolved administrations. :Dave BurkeAir fares to Portugal rise sharply as country tipped to make green listAir fares to Portugal have already started to soar as airlines respond to high demand.British Airways is charging #xA for a flight from Heathrow to the Algarve on May , compared with #xA two days earlier.A Ryanair flight from Stansted to Lisbon costs #xA on May , more than double the price of #xA on May .Quarantine and coronavirus testing requirements for people arriving in or ing to England once foreign holidays are permitted will be based on a new traffic light system, with destinations placed on green, amber and red lists.In addition to not needing to quarantine on their , people arriving from a green list location will also only be required to take one post-arrival test.Those ing from an amber list country must self-isolate for at least five days and take a minimum of two tests.Most popular European destinations, such as Spain, Italy, France and Greece, are initially expected to be on this list, but could switch to green ahead of the peak summer holiday months. :Dave BurkeWhat are the rules for red list countries Brits ing to the UK from aposred listapos countries need to quarantine for at least  days in a designated hotel, forking up the costs from #xA, themselves.India is the latest country to have been added to Englandaposs red list after a surge in cases in the country and fears over a new iant. The new rules will come into force from am on April .That means that anyone who is ing from India to the UK after this time will be required to book in to a quarantine hotel.Only British nationals and UK residents will be allowed to enter the UKing from red list destinations.Those who are ing will need to book the quarantine hotel stay through the government website which will include the hotel stay, quarantine transport and Covid- tests that will need to be taken on days two and eight of your self-isolation. :Dave BurkeTui boss says summer holiday prices have not been ramped up ahead of announcementPrices for summer breaks have not been ramped up ahead of the Governmentaposs announcement of the green travel list, the UKaposs largest holiday firm insisted.Tuiaposs managing director for the UK and Ireland, Andrew Flintham, said it will be a long time before travel companies can consider boosting profit margins.He told BBC Breakfast: Our prices are very, very stable. Theyaposre pretty much like for like, flat, year over year. There isnapost a big increase in there.Weaposve got plenty of holidays to sell. I think everybody in the industry has.Itaposll be a long time before the idea of trying to increase prices to make more money. We want to get people away on holiday, having a great time, because we think they genuinely all deserve it. :KEY EVENTGovernment plans to play it safe with small list of green countriesThe Government is expected to unveil its travel green list in a pm press conference, with details of where holidaymakers can book an overseas break without having to isolate on theirhome.The Downing Street press conference is currently expected to be hosted by Transport Secretary Grant Shapps.The ban on non-essential foreign travel for England is due to be lted on May  under Boris Johnsonaposs roadmap out of lockdown.Today people will finally be able to begin planning a sunshine break when the Government publishes details of which countries are safest to visit from that date.But it is understood that the first green list could be small, with a source telling the Mirror that the Government plans to #xCplay it safe#xD.Click here for the full story More OnGrant ShappsCoronavirus

title: harry didnt explain royal life
story: NewsHarry didnt explain royal le isnt like being a celebrity before marrying MeghanAuthor Ingrid Seward argued Prince Harry may not have made it clear to Meghan Markle how much her le would change as she moved from mere celebrity status to a full member of the royal familymirrorShareCommentsByAbigail OLearyReporter:,  MAY NewsIn a groundbreaking tell-all interview with Oprah Winfrey, Meghan herself told how she was unaware of certain rules she needed to follow after marrying Harry. " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeHarry did not explain royal le isnapost like being a celebrity to Meghan before they got married, a royal expert claims.Author Ingrid Seward argued Prince Harry may not have made it clear to Meghan how much her le would change as she moved from a person of celebrity status to a fully-fledged member of the royal family.Seward claimed becoming a member of the Firm meant focussing most of ones efforts on the Crown as opposed to the inidual.She went on to suggest Meghan Markle may not have been fully aware of the nature of her role within the family.Speaking to Page Six, Ms Seward said Prince Harry didn’t explain to her the ordinary things about being royal. That it’s not about you, it’s about the monarchy — it’s not like being a celebrity. In a groundbreaking tell-all interview with Oprah Winfrey, Meghan herself told how she was unaware of certain rules she needed to follow after marrying Harry. She spoke of an informal family gathering attended by the Queen, at which she was not aware she still needed to formally curtsey to the Monarch. Meghan told the US talk show host: I would say I went into it naively because I didn’t grow up knowing much about the Royal Family. Oprah asked whether she did any research before marrying into the family, with Meghan replying: No. I didn’t feel any need to, because everything I needed to know [Prince Harry] was sharing with me. Everything we thought I needed to know, he was telling me.  I didn’t fully understand what the job was: What does it mean to be a working royal  The Duchess of Sussex announced earlier this week that she has written the new book, titled The Bench, which tells the story of fathers and their sons through a motheraposs eyes. Many fans have praised the book and thousands have already pre-ordered a copy. However Seward believes that one of the pages shows the coupleaposs feelings towards Harry losing his royal military positions following Megxit. Keep up to date with all the latest news from the Queen, Charles, William, Kate, Harry, Meghan, George, Charlotte, Louis, Archie and the rest of the family. Weaposll send the best Royal news directly to your inbox so you never have to miss a thing.to our newsletter here.

title: inside creepy 30 room mansion
story: NewsInside the creepy -room mansion covered in mould and left to rot since its owners diedThe walls and ceilings of the Oxford manor were covered in black mould as a result of damage to the roof which allowed water to seep in when it rained and an indoor pool was pictured filled with debris and grimemirrorShareCommentsByMartin RuffellDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  MAY NewsThe front garden of the former fishery lies completely flooded " to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.SubscribeWhen you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeCreepy photos show inside a spooky abandoned thirty-room manor house left to decay after its owners died three years ago. The walls and ceilings of the manor were covered in black mould as a result of damage to the roof which allowed water to seep in when it rained. In another, an indoor swimming pool could be seen filled with debris and grime after being left for many years. One photo from inside the manor showed an ornate-wooden led living room complete with a stunning -foot-wide stone and cast-iron fireplace. The photos were taken by urban explorer and chemical exporter Steven Bailey, , from Oxford who visited the former fish breeding farm in Oxford in January .  He described the amount of mould in the property as insane. The grand manor was abandoned in  after both of its owners sadly passed away. The property was converted into a fish breeding farm in , before being refurbished in , once again becoming a private residence.  Steven captured the photos of the once glorious home on a Canon dsr. The level of mould in this place was insane, said Steven. It was all over the wall and ceiling and furniture and was due to the fact that the roof had a huge leak in it, so water was dripping through and soaking everything. Despite this, a lot of the manor was still in a remarkably good condition. There were ornate pieces of wooden furniture in most of the rooms and pictures of the previous owners of the house and even their pets in a lot of the rooms. The most interesting find was definitely the large and grand fireplace in the living room. That would have been an amazing place to sit and relax in the past.

title: irish cafe owners sent anonymous
story: :root Owners of Irish cafe in Coventry stunned by anonymous IRA note in postOTooles Cafe in Earlsdon, Coventry, posted about the incident on its Facebook page and was immediately inundated with support from disgusted locals, all voicing their supportOwners of Irish cafe in Coventry stunned by anonymous IRA note in postOTooles Cafe in Earlsdon, Coventry, posted about the incident on its Facebook page and was immediately inundated with support from disgusted locals, all voicing their supportOTooles Cafe in Earlsdon, Coventry, is a popular spot in the city, famed for their Irish breakfastsImage: CoventryWSByNaomi de Souza:,  May Updated:,  May The owners of an Irish cafe which received an anonymous note accusing them of displaying aposIRA flagsapos have spoken of their shock at the unsettling incident. OaposTooles Cafe in Earlsdon, Coventry, is a popular spot in the city, famed for their Irish breakfasts and freshly baked goods. Opened in , the cafe displays the Irish flag and Irish flag bunting above their seating area. But on the morning of May , they received an anonymous typed note that said: How long are the IRA banners going to be there The Westwood Road venue posted about the incident on its Facebook page and was immediately inundated with support from disgusted locals, all voicing their support, reports Coventry Live.Writing on their Facebook page on Thursday May , owner Isobell Adams wrote: Firstly, please excuse what could be a long post. I received this through the post today, to say I am shocked is an understatement. I thought this nonsense was long behind us as a society. I have no IRA banners in my cafe. I have bunting that denotes the tricolour, the flag of Ireland. I have the Irish flag painted on my sign, that is all. I won’t give this any more credence. We have tried so hard to integrate with a fantastic community and we have been warmly received. This is so sad.Speaking to CoventryLive the day after the incident, owner Isobell Adams said: It came in with the ordinary post, itaposs hard to say, itaposs just quite unsettling really, when you look at it from face value itaposs all a bit silly, butyou feel this deeply, a why because I donapost have any paramilitary regalia and b how far are you prepared to take it  What might you do next  She added: I put the post up because I was so saddened by the whole thing, we have been so accepted by the whole Earlsdon community, and tried to show weaposre not just here for our benefit, weaposre here to be part of the community and do anything we can, so it all just felt a bit horrible, is the only word.OaposTooles opened in November , and like many in the hospitality industry, have faced an uphill battle to stay open during the pandemic.  Explaining the history behind the cafe, she explained OaposTooles is her motheraposs maiden name, and a nod to her family in County Mayo, who were known for their baking. Itaposs nothing fancy, just good Irish home cooking, and thataposs all this is for, a little nod to my mum, my Aunty Celia, a nod to them thataposs all it is, we make our own potato cakes, soda bread.Ms Adams said since the incident, the cafe has been busier than ever, with Earlsdon locals popping in with flowers and well wishes to show their support.The support from this community has been, I donapost even know how to put it into words, it really is humbling, I put the post up because I felt it ought to be shared, and I knew that the community were behind us, but to this degree  Theyaposve just been absolutely overwhelming, and itaposs just so so lovely. As far as Iaposm concerned that was yesterday, with the support weaposve got from the community Iaposm not going to dwell on someoneaposs negativity.The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Coventry Irish Society also voiced their support for OaposTooles, writing on their page: We were very shocked to hear of the letter that OaposTooles Cafe received regarding the Irish flags on the building.We very much support OaposTooles Cafe in celebrating their heritage and those in and around the Earlsdon area. We are deeply saddened to see that this sort of intolerance has been displayed in Coventry when we are being celebrated as the City of Culture . Coventry residents were quick to voice their support for the cafe on its Facebook page, with more than  people commenting.

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeMeghan Markle and Prince Harry ripped up the royal rule book when it came to welcoming their son Archie, attracting praise from around the world for doing things their own way. While some people were disappointed that they couldnapost gather outside the hospital or see the traditional photos, the couple still included well-wishers by arranging a photocall at Windsor Castle and new dad Harry gave a spontaneous interview. But there was one aspect they legally had to share with the world - Archieaposs birth certicate. The document, like all birth certicates, was a matter of public record, regardless of your royal status. It revealed for the first time where Archie was born, the Portland Hospital, and also showed an interesting detail about Meghan - her official job title. The document lists her role as Princess of the United Kingdom. It left many fans scratching their heads, wondering why it said princess when Meghanaposs official title is Duchess. While she was given the title the Duchess of Sussex by the Queen on her wedding day, she is also technically a princess, just not in her own name. She is Her Royal Highness Princess Henry of Wales through her husband, Harry. The Duchess of Cambridge also listed princess under the job section part of the form on Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louisaposs birth certicates.  However there was further confusion around Archieaposs birth certicate in January when it emerged that Meghan and Harry changed it months after officially registering his birth. The couple removed Rachel Meghan from the aposmotheraposs nameapos section, leaving simple the Duchess of Sussex.Days after the changes were made, Harry and Meghan walked away from the Fab Four’s joint charity and had quit the Royal family within months.Some experts claimed it could be seen as a snub to Prince William and Kate, who have her name on George, Charlotte and Archieaposs unorm, however this was quickly rubbished by the couple.

title: mum two took life hours
story: NewsMum-of-two took her own le hours after laughing with the kids in gardenJade Roberts, , suffered from anxiety, but her family said they were not aware of the true extent of what she was going through. She left a letter to her loved ones before her tragic death in AprilmirrorShareByCharlotte HadfieldChiara Fiorillo:,  MAY NewsJade Roberts died last month " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA mum-of-two took her own le hours after laughing and playing with her children in the garden. Jade Roberts, , suffered from anxiety, but her family said they were not aware of the true extent of what she was going through. The womanaposs cousin Karl Thomas, , said she sent him a video of herself playing with her children shortly before taking her own le.Jade, from Knotty Ash, Liverpool, left a letter to her loved ones before her tragic death in April, the Liverpool Echo reports.Her family paid tribute to her and described her as an unbelievable mum to her two sons - aged one and two years old.  Karl told the ECHO: She had all the people around her in the world but it just shows you, you can be surrounded by people and still feel alone.Itaposs so important that people do talk about how they are feeling instead of bottling things up. There need to be more s for people to do this I think, now more than ever. People have always been suffering but I think now itaposs coming from all angles and youaposre hearing about it more and more. A few hours before her death, Karl said Jade sent him a video of herself playing with her children in the garden. He said: You couldnapost see her because the camera was on the kids but sheaposs laughing in the video. She was an unbelievable mum. Every minute of the day was dedicated to her children. They are very happy and loving children and it speaks volumes of the person she was because kids are a blank canvas at the end of the day. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Karl said: She genuinely had the biggest heart of gold. She would do anything for anybody. She was always more worried about other people and tried to sort out other peopleaposs problems. Maybe that came from knowing how they felt and she didnapost want people feeling that way.A GoFundMe page set up by Jadeaposs friend Madina Wady to raise money for her two sons has raised over £, so far.Karl said the family have been blown away by the support they have received since Jadeaposs death.

title: nick faldo marries ex topless
story: NewsNick Faldo marries ex-topless dancer - golf heros fourth we and her seventh marriageEXCLUSIVE: Golfing legend Sir Nick Faldo has made a former topless dancer his fourth we - and its husband number seven for Lindsay De Marco, who has gone by  dferent names and had  addresses- and has drug convictionsmirrorShareCommentsByChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsNick and Lindsay enjoying some sun " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeSir Nick Faldo appears to have quietly got hitched again – to his former topless dancer girlfriend.Lindsay De Marco has now proudly changed her name to “Lindz Faldo” on her Facebook page.Sources say the -year-old, who met Faldo in , “revels” in being a Lady. It is Faldo’s fourth marriage and the seventh for Lindsay, who has gone by  dferent names and had  addresses. Randy Heine, who was married to her twice, wished Sir Nick, , “good luck”. What is your view  Have your say in the comment section A source told the Mirror: “Lindz has found everything she wants in a husband - handsome, kind, a knight and a multi-millionaire. What more can a girl ask for ” So close are the couple TV sources say Sir Nick was keen to include her in his CBS Sports show, called Faldo Formula. For her new Facebook profile picture, Lindsay uses a photo of herself with the six-time Major winner dressed as James Bond and her as his Bond girl. Faldo looks into the camera and says: “The name’s Faldo. Sir Nick Faldo. Cheers”. Lindsay then takes his drink off him before she rips off his dinner suit to show him dressed for golf. Two years ago, the Mirror revealed Faldo was dating Lindsay, who has drug convictions and once made her living “jiggling her boobs” in men’s faces. When approached by the Mirror, she denied having worked as a dancer. But ex-husband Randy – married to her twice – told how she performed as ‘Toni’ in the mid-s at his Florida club, Astra bar.  Randy had claimed she kept trading hubbies because she was “consumed” with climbing the social ladder. He offered to meet Faldo, worth around £million, saying: “I’d bring him up to date about how long his marriage might last and how much he’ll have to payit doesn’t work out,” he said. Randy and Lindsay got in trouble in  when she was a boss at one of his businesses, The Tobacco Emporium. It was was one of  stores in Florida raided by the FBI. Both were charged with drug offences, including possession of marijuana and selling drugs paraphernalia. Lindsay pleaded no contest and got a  fine and six months probation.  Two years later, in a federal court, she struck a deal and entered a guilty plea to one charge of “use of interstate conveyance to ship drug paraphernalia”. She receieved six months of house detention. By the time of her sentencing, Lindsay had wed Col Nicholas De Marco, as a “career officer” in the US Air Force. Although they orced, she reverted to using his surname at golfing events.  The fourth man she married was Thomas Bracken, and she then wed multi-millionaire Scott Sangalli. Faldo, who flits across the Atlantic with Lindsay from a £million bungalow in Florida to a riverside flat overlooking Windsor Castle has been in the rough in his personal le several times. His marriage to first we Melanie Rockall ended after four-and-a-half years. He then married Gill Bennett, with whom he had three kids. The Prince of Wales is said to still be angry over his sonaposs tell-all sit-down with Oprah Winfrey, which rocked the royal family.A source has told Us Weekly that the way things are going, Charles may never forgive Harry.But they added that this stance has caused friction with the Queen - with the ill relations described as drama she can do without.Harry and his fatheraposs relationship is said to have soured after he and we Meghan Markle spoke to Winfrey in March. Do you have a view on this story  Email webnews@mirror or let us know in the comments below.The Duke of Sussex, who now lives in the US, jetted back to Britain in April to attend his grandfather Prince Philipaposs funeral. It has been widely reported that Harry, Charles and Prince William met after the ceremony to talk, but this has not been confirmed. The trio are said to have tried to discuss their dferences and problems, especially in the wake of the controversial interview. But it has now been claimed that Charles may never fully forgive his son.  The unnamed insider told the US publication: With the way things are going, Charles may never forgive Harry, which hasn’t gone down well with Elizabeth. She feels that he’s putting his pride before the best interest of the monarchy. She has enough on her plate dealing with the loss of her husband. It’s drama she can do without. The Queen lost her husband of  years when Philip died, but has been seen to be carrying on stoically after his passing. She appeared smiling on a video call to greet dignitaries from Windsor Castle just days after the funeral. The source added that it may be William who has to bridge the gap and speak to Harry, as they say Charles is stubborn. He believes that in order to repair damage and destruction from Harry’s interview, the best approach is to keep things civil with his brother rather than fanning the flames and fighting back with a tit-for-tat attitude, they said.

The couple managed to keep the weekend away a surprise as Sue frantically tried to get everything packed and ready. title: waitress 20 gives birth baby
story: NewsWaitress, , gives birth to baby just hours after suffering tummy ache on shtThe young mum had a negative pregnancy test just five months before giving birth as her friend had been too scared to do one on her own so Jodi had taken one for moral supportmirrorShareCommentsByNia PriceGraeme Murray:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsJodie-Marie Ash gave birth hours after finishing her sht " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA waitress who had stomach ache at work was shocked when she gave birth to a baby hours after finishing her sht. Jodi-Marie Ash thought she had eaten something that disagreed with her when she developed pains in her tummy. By the end of her eight-hour sht was in excruciating pain and was rushed to hospital. But when the -year-old arrived she was told she was pregnant and already in labour and gave birth to her baby girl an hour later. Jodi was on the contraceptive pill throughout her pregnancy but admits she had sometimes forgotten to take it. But with no bump and no other symptoms, had no idea she was pregnant. The young mum claims she had a negative pregnancy test just five months before giving birth as her friend had been too scared to do one on her own so Jodi had taken one for moral support. She even went clubbing for her th birthday and climbed the  Arena while blissfully unaware that she was carrying her baby . The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Now her daughter Skyla Grimsey is one, Jodi claims she takes a pregnancy test every three months to ensure she is not taken by surprise again. Jodi-Marie, of Basildon, Essex, said: I went to hospital with a stomach ache and came out with a baby. I thought the pain was appendicitis, stomach ache or Iaposd eaten something wrong - I was thinking of all these sorts of things but didnapost think for a second that I was in labour.  I didnapost have any symptoms - I was on my period the whole time and wasnapost sick or nauseous at all. There was no form of a bump as such - after I ate I got more bloated than usual but there wasnapost anything to be majorly concerned about to the point where I thought I could be pregnant. Jodi-Marie woke up on May ,  and, despite having a few stomach problems, went to work.  She said: The doctor said to me aposoh, weaposre going to do a pregnancy test on youapos and I was like aposright okapos and it came back positive. After he said I was pregnant I said straight away aposwhy am I in so much pain though apos Because being pregnant doesnapost mean you should be in that much pain. He said that they had to send me for some more tests and I was on the wheelchair going to the delivery room not knowing I was going there and the porter told me thataposs where I was going and I was about to give birth. I think I was shocked and surprised more than anything - it was all a bit surreal.  The whole night was a blur and did go really quickly but at the time I just remember thinking that I just had to get the baby out. After under an hour of active labour, her baby girl Skyla was born at :am weighing lbs oz. The young mum said that both her family and Skylaaposs fatheraposs family were on hand throughout the whole process and helped to provide supplies for their newborn baby at such short notice.

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA woman lost st after becoming housebound while she was eating herself to death. Karina Dunford, , said she ordered takeaways, ate chocolate and drank  cans of cola every day. She became housebound and when she reached her heaviest weight - st lbs - she had to rely on her husband Ian to help wash and dress her.Now, the woman from Bridgend in South Wales, has lost st lb in two years after embarking on a diet journey with Slimming World, the Liverpool Echo reports.Karina said: I had a rough time when I was overweight. I felt that I embarrassed my whole family. I was bullied and felt that no one cared about me. “I was so unhappy and my health was getting worse by the day. I just wanted to stay in every day with my husband Ian and never wanted to leave the house. Karina said she tried many diets but never managed to lose weight until she decided to join Slimming World in January .  Her weight loss meant she slimmed down from a size  to a size . She has also been named Slimming World’s Greatest Loser Karina said: Since losing weight my husband Ian and I have a much better le. Now I have the confidence to do things for myself and Ian doesn’t have to care for me. Her eating pattern has improved thanks to her diet and she now eats more fruit and vegetables - while limiting processed food and takeaways. She enjoys cooking and plans her meals for all the week - sticking to her plan. Karina also decided to join the gym and her confidence has improved after losing weight.

title: cafe owners brutal reply idiot
story: NewsCafe owners brutal reply to idiot that left -star review over lack of beansBankhouse Diner  Bar owner Rebekka didnt hold back when she received two negative Google reviews which criticised her portion sizes, missing menu items and coronavirus safety meauresmirrorShareCommentsByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  MAY NewsRebekka hit back " %, rgba, rgba, url" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your dayInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.SubscribeWhen you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice A cafe owner has hit out at an unhappy customer who left a one-star Google review after his sandwich wasnapost served with beans - despite it not being listed as a side on the menu. Rebekka Jane, who runs Bankhouse Diner  Bar in Stafford, went on a self-described rant on Facebook after she received two petty reviews online.One review was made by a man who claimed he and his family were forced to aposhead straight to McDonaldapossapos after ordering a £ breakfast sandwich, as he complained that the portion sizes were terrible for the price. He then went on to say how annoyed he was that it wasnapost served with baked beans. Concluding the review, he revealed he wouldn’t eat here again. Speaking of the complaint in her online post, Rebekka said that her s cafe prides itself on a friendly atmosphere and fresh food – McDonald’s certainly isn’t either of those.  Another customer then complained about their food being served in a takeaway box - a decision made by Rebekka to ensure she is in keeping with coronavirus precautions.She then called out criminals who targeted her American diner on three occasions, telling how the thieves took off with parasols, and others customers left without paying. She said: I cannot understand people sometimes. Hereaposs a little rant from me as I believe in speaking my mind and looking after our fellow traders and businesses and aposouting thieves and idiotsapos.  This past fortnight we’ve had two sets of people purposely not pay for their meals and drinks and one set tried to scam our card reader and not pay. We have you both on CCTV and the card scamming couple have been reported to the police.Weaposve also had two unhelpful reviews on Google. One guy was upset he didn’t get beansand apparently they had to go to McDonald’s as they were still hungry.The other was a review by a woman stating that she didn’t like her food being served in a box . For the love of God!  We are trying to adhere to Covid regulations. They both left one star reviews based on those facts. Speak to us! Small issues like these can always be rectied. And last night some little chav stole our parasols. If you saw a young white male on May  around midnight carrying parasols through town - they are ours! None of the people that did these things will care but please just know that people like YOU damage small businesses like OURS. We’ve been through  months of not being able to trade properly and not earn.

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA former fitness teacher is cashing in on her exercise skills by posting sexy pictures of her toned physique in skimpy underwear for younger men. Sandy Star, who once worked as an aerobics instructor, has proved a huge hit with men half her age by modelling as a muscly MILF, and earns £, a month for her efforts. The -year-old has been working as a model for two years and says fans as young as her own -year-old son are ‘obsessed’ with her because she’s an older woman who loves to lt weights. There is a total obsession with being a aposmilfapos and I have been told by my fans how much they love older women, Sandy told Jam Press. When I ask why, Iaposm told itaposs because we know what we want, how we want it done and weaposre not afraid to ask Older women have a confidence about them that younger girls donapost always have, a confidence that comes with age.Before entering into the industry I also had no idea men were so submissive to strong and powerful women with a lot of muscles.Sandy was working as a personal trainer and aerobics instructor when she quit her job in , after a friend suggested she become a webcam model and show off her body online for men who like muscular women.  She gave it a try and within months was earning between £,-£,. Now Sandy regularly makes £, a month and says she is inundated with attention from ‘milf-obsessed’ men half her age. Part of her online persona - Miss Sandy - also involves her acting and dressing as a dominant. But she says she enjoys the iety of her work and being in charge when it comes to her submissive fans.  Before entering into the industry, I also had no idea men were so submissive to strong and powerful women with a lot of muscles,” Sandy, from Hertfordshire, said. A lot of men will comment on me aposnot looking apos, which is a real boost, and I am always appreciative of nice comments, there is no such thing as a bad comment - itaposs just their opinion and an opinion cannot be wrong.” Despite her own son only being , Sandy also said he was “very supportive” of her work – as is her partner Ryan, , whom is actually a former fan. We met through camming and dated last year,” Sandy explained. “As he was in a relationship, I decided I didnapost want to take it any further as this was not my style, but a short while after our dates, Ryan decided he wanted to be with me full time and we now live together.He is fully accepting of my job in every sense, supportive and encouraging every day. I couldnapost really ask for any more from him.Yes, itaposs a little alternative but when Iaposm home Iaposm me, when Iaposm working, Iaposm Sandy and thataposs it! Aside from a boob job back in  which was later revised, Sandy claims the rest of her body is all her own work. The gym-goer stays in shape by weight-lting several times a week and making sure she limits cardio. “My main focus of training has always been strength and weight training over cardio,” she explained.
