title: senedd election  candidates cardiff south penarth
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityNasir Adam - Plaid CymruRaised in Butetown, the son and grandson of merchant navy, Irsquove lived in Cardf South my whole le and itrsquos where I still work and live and itrsquos here Irsquom raising my family. During my  years as a community campaigner I have passionately campaigned for education, creating more opportunities for young people, tackling the housing crisis and the climate crisis. I was the regeneration officer for the Loudoun Square and Trowbridge redevelopment, and was selected as the Wales delegate for the International Association for Community Development and Commonwealth Games in Glasgow . Over the last  years Irsquove supported young people in Cardf South and Penarth to develop their skills in the arts and creative industries and to participate in a wide range of opportunities. I successfully gained the London  Olympic Cultural Inspire Mark for Butetown Community. I entered politics because of the increasing injustice around me - increasing food banks, homelessness, education, climate crisis, lack of opportunity for our youth, lack of affordable housing I was sick and tired of our communities being treated like second class citizens by the London elite. I want a fair deal for our communities for Cardf South and Penarth and for Wales.Alan Golding - Freedom Alliance. No Lockdown. No CurfewsRaised in Tonyrefail, Rhondda Cynon Taff, I have since lived in Brighton and Glasgow, moving to Cardf in . Since my early twenties Irsquove been interested in the workings of society and how we treat each other, animals and our planethellip and in the process Irsquove come to completely mistrust virtually all career politicians. I believe a new way of doing politics is needed in Wales with a new set of values across the whole system. I donrsquot believe the current political structure and its controllers have the interest of the people at its heart with regard to their mental and physical health, their quality of le and spiritual and economic well-being.     Paul Campbell - UKIPHello Im Paul Campbell and Im standing in the Cardf South and South Wales Central area for UKIP in the Senedd elections on MAY TH.Being. Born in Cardf and lived most of my le there I appreciate the Greatv Potential the pride and the Welsh Identity in Cardf and the Valleys towns. and I have seen how things have changed over the years with parts of the area unrecognizable from the place I remember.Areas of Cardf have become run down and standards have fallen with a loss of community spirit The surrounding Towns have been neglected with. A lack of investment and job creation initiatives.Mass immigration in the UK has put tremendous strains on cities like Cardf Newport and Swansea with wage depression and overstretched public services.. The Conservatives claim to be in control of immigration but they will only ever talk about it and under there watch in the in the last  years  million more people have come to our shires thats  cities the sthe size of Cardf . Increasingly they are choosing to come to Wales as Labour has encouraged them by a making Wales a Nation Of sanctuary.Helen Westhead - Green PartyOur current administration has ignored the climate emergency and has left so many people vulnerable and excluded. As we recover from the pandemic we have unique opportunity to create better ways of working - the influence of an elected Green in the room will be transformative.We see from across the UK, Europe, and beyond the incredible dference Greens make, holding government to account, speaking out against inequality, and representing real people and their communities, not political or corporate interest. Wales is long overdue that representation in the Senedd.We know that the way we recover from this pandemic and build back stronger is through investing in communities and public services, ensuring everyone has access to local facilities, and supporting small business. If elected, one of my main priorities would be better walking and cycling routes, connected to affordable public transport and green outdoor spaces that communities can enjoy. Advocating for a Universal Basic Income would ensure no one is left behind in our bold plan to transform Wales.With the more proportional voting system on the regional ballot in Wales, Labour cannot win regional seats. A Green vote on your second ballot is the only progressive option.Matt Friend - PropelPropel has led the campaigns on two of the most important issues affecting Barry, Penarth and Cardf.Wersquore the only party that has committed not to allow any nuclear mud to be dumped in our waters, including the mud dredged from outside Hinkley nuclear reactor in Somerset.And wersquore the only party that even mentions the scandal of dangerous fire risk cladding on so many of our flats and buildings. Through our Contract with Wales we have committed not to issue new building contracts to any housing developer involved in the scandal, until they have paid to fix the problem they created.Wersquoll also end the way leaseholders are getting rinsed by introducing a service charge cap, linked to the Retail Price Index. That will stop the double digit increases in service charges that leaseholders have had to put up with.Most importantly, wersquoll introduce a Coronavirus Recovery Act to end Welsh lockdowns, save lives and restore freedoms. We canrsquot just hope wersquoll get our freedoms back, we have to vote for them.The ten laws in our Contract with Wales will transform our nation. Wales needs champions. Vote Propel.Alex Wilson, Liberal DemocratsI live with my family in Penarth and I became involved in politics because of the widening isions that seemed to occurring our community. I feel that with the Liberal Democrat core values of tolerance and understanding we can bring people back together. We can cut through the shouting of partisan politics and once again listen to what people want in their community.The next five years is going to be critical and I feel the Senedd must put recovery first. That means recovering from the Covid pandemic, the recovery of our economy, better healthcare services and a happier community which can be achieved by better transport links, saving our environment and ato community values.Irsquove been around long enough to know a political status-quo without a strong opposition can breed complacency. Wersquove seen this in national and local government. If I am elected I will ensure that the voice of the people is heard. If yoursquove ever wondered how we almost lost the Kymin or how they plan to build over  homes on contaminated land at Cosmeston Farm in Sully, well itrsquos because our current political leaders often lack empathy with local communities.Other candidates standing are:Vaughan Gething - LabourAngus Hawkins - Gwlad The Welsh Independence PartyLisa Peregrine ndash Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party Alan Pick ndash Reform UKDavid Rolfe ndash IndependentLeighton Rowlands ndash Conservative article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth woman raises   memory childhood friend
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityVerity Louise Tucker, , completed the run on Saturday, May  after giving herself a month to prepare while currently undertaking a PGCSE to become a secondary school maths teacher.The run started in Talbot reen and ended in Cardf Bay by the Millennium Centre.Miss Tucker was joined by her two friends Zoe Fullbrook and Sian Smith, who agreed to join her in raising money for her friend Mason Ah-Mun who died on March ,  at the age of  to sudden arrythmia death syndrome . was joined by her two friends Zoe Fullbrook and Sian Smith" alt"Penarth Times: Miss Tuckerwas joined by her two friends Zoe Fullbrook and Sian Smith" class"editor-image"Miss Tuckerwas joined by her two friends Zoe Fullbrook and Sian SmithBoth were former pupils of Farfield Primary and in the same class.ldquoHe will always be in my heart and will be beside me each and every day - I hope I have and continue to make him proud. We love him and miss him so much, she said.ldquoI think his family are absolutely incredible, their strength and love is immense. You can totally see where Mason got his beautul personality from.Mason Ah-Mun died at the age of  ldquoI am so honoured to have been able to do this for them all. They will always have my heart.Masonrsquos family decided to set up a free phone app called MASwhich allows people to locate their closest defibrillator and can be used across the UK.Setting up an app costs money, so Maxine Ah-Mun, Masonrsquos mum, set up a small business selling soups.MORE NEWS:ldquoOne day I saw Maxine was selling soups during the week called @Soup_a_soup on Instagram, added Miss Tucker.ldquoShe sells them in Penarth and can be pre ordered by messaging her on Instagram or Facebook.ldquoI contacted Maxine, checking in on her, and asked about the app and how the money raising was going and askedI could help at all.      with his mum Maxine Ahmun and brother Benjamin Ahmun" alt"Penarth Times: Masonwith his mum Maxine Ahmun and brother Benjamin Ahmun" class"editor-image"Masonwith his mum Maxine Ahmun and brother Benjamin AhmunldquoI have never been a runner - always struggled with it, but started doing short runs during lockdown just for fitness and then started running for charity.In April , during first lockdown, she completed  miles in nine days for Alzheimerrsquos Society and during January of this year raised money for Maggiersquos Charity where she ran  miles throughout the month.ldquoSo, for MAS app, I set up a fundraiser with just giving to raise money. Our aim was to raise pound but we are now exceeding pound, she said.At the end of her run she was met by lots of Masonrsquos family and friends, as well as her own.To donate head tohttps:www.justgiving crowdfunding verity-tucker utm_termQmrWVAgk.ldquoIt was incredible and I am honoured to have been able to do this for them and for the memory of Mason," she added. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: senedd election    need know
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySenedd Election  - all you need to know about voting during coronavirus" Senedd Election  - all you need to know about voting during coronavirusBallot box" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentTODAYS the day - the Senedd Election is here, and, with coronavirus uncertainty still lingering in everyday le, people may still have some questions about what will happen.Today the people of Wales will vote to decide who their Senedd Members will be for the next five years.There are  MSs in total.The election will also decide who forms the next Welsh Government - responsible for hospitals, schools and transport in Wales.The Welsh Government is formed from the party holding the most seats and is led by the first minister.If a single party wins more than  seats, they are able to form a government. Otherwise a coalition must be attempted.:Who can vote Anyone over the age of  can vote in the Senedd election provided they are:- registered to do so- living in Wales- not legally excluded from votingThis is the first time  and -year-olds have been eligible to vote. What impact that has on the result remains to be seen.How do I vote There are three ways - in person, by post and by proxy - however, the deadlines for latter two options have already passed.Voting at the polling booth with take place until pm today.Polling stations will be kitted out with hand sanitiser and distancing markers to help voters remain safe from coronavirus.Most crucially, voters are being asked to bring their own pen or pencil.Face coverings must also be worn, unless exempt.How does the voting system work Each voter will have two votes - one constituency vote and one regional vote.Youll be represented in the Senedd by five Members. One for your constituency and four for the region of Wales where you live.Constituency vote - this is for the person you want to represent you and your local area. Wales has  constituencies, with each being represented by one MS in the Senedd. Constituency votes are counted in a first past the post system - so the candidate with the most votes is elected.     Regional vote - This is for who you want to represent your region of Wales - South Wales East, South Wales Central, South Wales West Mid and West Wales and North Wales. There are  regional Senedd Members, elected by the additional member system.When will results be announced As with a lot of things this past year, the election has been hit by Covid restrictions.While voting will happen today, counting will not take place the same night as is usually the case on election night.Instead, the votes will be taken to the counting locations and kept secure until morning.They will then be veried - spoiled ballots removed - and counted.Due to Covid restrictions, this will likely take longer than in normal counts, but results are expected within two days of polls closing.Keep an eye on the Argus website for the latest, and results. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: aldi bring back christmas favourite brits prepare celebrate junemas
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAs anticipation builds for lockdown restrictions lting completely on June , Brits are gearing up to enjoy the Christmas we never had on June .With limited celebrations in December amid coronavirus lockdown restrictions research has shown that nearly half of Britsare planning to celebrate lsquoJunemasrsquo with friends and family next month.Itrsquos clear with December lockdown now a distant memory, the thought of Christmas and being reunited with our friends and family has us feeling all sentimental.And to help Brits celebrate the festivities, Aldi is bringing back its popular Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies." alt"Penarth Times: Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies. " class"editor-image"Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies. When asked what festive food they would most like to see back on shelves this Junemas, half of Britslisted mince pies as their quintessential Christmas treat.Web searches for lsquomince piesrsquo also went up by an incredible % in April alone, as the nation prepares to celebrate Christmas this summer.With % of people planning a lockdown-lting party, the most popular celebration is set to be with our closest friends, with over % of those polled looking forward to being reunited with pals theyrsquove missed, closely followed by get-togethers with extended family .Julie Ashfield, Managing Director of Buying at Aldi, commented: ldquoThe first Friday post-lockdown will feel like Christmas, as we all get to meet up with friends and family after months apart.ldquoWe thought letrsquos make it a Junemas to remember by bringing back the nations festive favourite - mince pies - to help celebrate this very special occasion!Aldirsquos Specially Selected Mini Mince Pies will be available for pound. in-store nationwide from st June.Follow Aldi as it gears up for the summer celebrations on #AldiJunemas where shoppers can cast their vote on what other yuletide favourites they would like to see back in store for Junemas. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: new pathway college commence university south wales
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe pathway and English-language programmes will support students who need to develop their English-language ability and academic study skills to offer guaranteed progression routes into business, computing, engineering, and creative industries, with applied science and sports science on offer at a later date.QAHE is well-established in the international pathways market, with partnerships in place with Northumbria University, University of Roehampton, and Solent University, as well as other Higher Education partnerships with Ulster University, Middlesex University, and London politan University.It has strong international recruitment and marketing capabilities, including a large network of international representatives and a strong track record of progression in the classroom with its university partners. The first cohort of students will commence in autumn .MORE NEWS:Professor Julie Lydon, USW Vice-Chancellor, said: ldquoIrsquom delighted that the University of South Wales has been able to secure this partnership with QAHE, which has a track record of delivering similar provision to overseas students at a number of UK institutions.ldquoBy recognising the needs of a wider section of international students and providing them with the support to reach their potential, we will further enhance our reputation as an international institution that offers world-leading qualications.ldquoAt USW, we have many yearsrsquo experience of providing first-class learning to students from across the globe, and we can use this expertise to ensure these integrated programmes provide the next generation of students with an education that is second to none.     Growing its international footprint is a strategic priority for USW. As well as supporting the delivery of the wider internationalisation strategy, the partnership will further enhance ersity across the international cohort and provide a new channel of recruitment that will help to future-proof the University against the impacts of Brexit and an increasingly challenging international sector.Julie Noone, Chief Executive of QAHE, said: ldquoWe are delighted to be working with University of South Wales on this new partnership which will provide increased subject and location choices for International students within the QAHE portfolio of partners and courses.ldquoUSW has very strong International ambitions and we are very happy to be working with a new partner with such ambition in this area.The campuses and range of subjects are outstanding and extremely attractive for International students.Further information about the partnership and the courses available are on the QA Higher Education website https:qahighereducation . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth school celebrates teacher heroes teacher appreciation week
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe school, which has recently reopened its doors following the national school closures, has been applauded by parents for its handling of the pandemic and the focus placed throughout lockdown on pupil safety and wellbeing.This month sees students, parents and friends of the school, in the local community and further afield, come together to pay tribute to Westbournersquos teaching heroes.These are teachers who routinely go above and beyond their normal teaching duties ndash including providing unprecedented levels of support to pupils during the pandemic, both academically and pastorally initiating new ways of thinking and learning during lockdown to help pupils thrive and participating in initiatives outside school to help those in need in the wider community.Heres some of their teacher heroes:Year  teacher, Jessica ArmstrongThe inspirational DofE leader helping women and children in need.She is currently spearheading the Duke of Edinburgh Award scheme at the school, and also leads a iety of extra-curricular student groups including Running Club and Maths Booster Club to help pupils transition back to Maths class following lockdown.On Saturday she led a Duke of Edinburgh expedition training weekend for Year ,  and Sixth Form, where pupils learnt vital survival skills such as understanding kit and equipment, map reading and route planning, cooking and first aid.She accompanied pupils on a six-hour orienteering session, covering km through Dyffryn and Wenvoe.In addition to her day job, she is also involved with the charity Cardf Womens Aid which helps women and children who have been victims of domestic abuse and gender-based violence in often le-threatening situations.She has worked with the charity on setting up an Information Hub for women looking for support and advice.     Deputy Manager of Little Westbourne Nursery, Hannah BennettThe nursery leader who helped raise pound,She has worked tirelessly over the past year to ensure the wellbeing and happiness of the children in her care.She worked to keep the nursery running efficiently and safely during lockdown, when many local nurseries had closed their doors, manning the nursery with one other colleague for the children of key workers in addition to rolling out a lively programme of daily online learning and motivational activities for children at home. During lockdown, she also led one-to-one Zoom sessions with children and their parents to ensure the highest levels of pastoral support.She went above and beyond her normal teaching duties when, in March , she helped organise a fundraising campaign in aid of the Downrsquos Syndrome Association, inspired by a child close to the heart of Little Westbourne Nursery, raising an incredible pound,.Stuart Ayres, Director of Online LearningThe innovative teacher helping students gain new skills during lockdownWestbourne is one of the first schools in Wales to use AItechnology to help pupils learn.It was also ahead of the curve in its appointment of a Director of Online Education before the UK went into lockdown, meaning that Westbourne could move seamlessly to a full online learning offering from Day  of the nationwide school closures.Director of Online Learning, Stuart Ayres, established an innovative tech partnership that enabled the school to deliver a ground-breaking online learning  backed by articial intelligence and the latest thinking in neuroscience.MORE NEWS:The  works by generating mini-lessons that students use to complement their studies. If a student requires guidance in a particular academic area, the  recognises this and recommends mini-lessons to improve understanding.It can even do this in a cross-curricular sense, for example suggesting English mini-lessonsa studentrsquos misunderstanding of a Maths problem is based on a comprehension error. It also recognises when a student needs to be challenged, recommending limitless supplementary material in the core areas of English, Maths and Science.Westbourne School is based on Hickman Road, Penarth. Picture: Westbourne School Stuart Ayres said: ldquoDuring lockdown, we continued to explore new ways of teaching, new resources and cutting-edge technologies to support pupils at every stage.ldquoUniquely, Westbourne offered a combination of heavily personalised learning alongside the latest in AI-assisted learning technology, which undoubtedly helped our pupils to thrive."There has been concern in the media about students losing skills and academic knowledge during lockdown - it was quite the opposite in our case."Students actually came back to school with more refined digital skills than before, thanks to the new technology.ldquoArticial intelligence has now become part of the make-up of the school, and we continue to use it to enhance learning now that we are back in the physical classroom."In doing so wersquove been able to elevate the student experience at Westbourne to a whole new - and very exciting ndash level.Principal of Westbourne School, Dr Gerard Grfiths, said: ldquoWe count ourselves very lucky at Westbourne to have such a talented and dedicated teaching team. Teachers here regularly go far beyond what is required of them to support, motivate and engage pupils at an extremely high level.ldquoItrsquos only fitting that we take this opportunity, during Teacher Appreciation Week, to discuss and celebrate all that our teachers do on a daily basis, both in and out of school."Even during the pandemic, when the odds have been stacked against us all, their love for the job and desire to see pupils succeed has been unwavering. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth man ordered repay   selling counterfeit goods
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySean Payter was convicted in  following a Trading Standards investigation for the Vale of Glamorgan Council and today faced a Proceeds of Crime Hearing.There the judge decided he must repay a signicant sum gained from his illegal activity over the next three months.Shared Regulatory Services , who undertake trading standards work across the Local Authority areas of Bridgend, Cardf and the Vale, began investigating Mr Payter after receiving a complaint from the Assay Office, the body responsible for testing and hallmarking precious metals.The Assay Office had carried out a test purchase from gemgems, a company operated by Payter and Stefan Hodgson from Newport, that sold jewellery on eBay.It revealed that an item was not silver as described and did not contain the advertised gem stones.Further testing by SRS found that other items of jewellery were also misdescribed and that cosmetics being sold were unsafe and possibly infringed trademarks.After executing a warrant for the home of Payter, SRS officers seized jewellery, cosmetics and pound, in cash.The investigation showed that Payter and Hodgson had been trading for five years and at one point ran a website calledgemsgems.MORE NEWS:Check out these photos of the ambitious transformation at Whitmore High SchoolNew Pathway College announced at University of South WalesOutdoor show to come to Barrys MEMO Arts Centre later this month!They had been buying items such as necklaces, bracelets, bangles and earrings from a website in China without verying that they were as described.Counterfeit cufflinks and belts were also identied along with cosmetics that werenrsquot safe to be used.Payter, from St Davids Cresent in Penarth and Hodgson, of Park Drive Newport, both plead guilty to  offences in total two under Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations, six under the Hallmarking Act, two under Cosmetic Product Enforcement Regulations and two under the Trademarks Act.     In August  they were sentenced to a total of  months in prison, reduced to  months for early guilty pleas, suspended for  months. The pair also had to pay a victim surcharge of pound each.Cllr Eddie Williams, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Legal, Regulatory and Planning Services, said: ldquoThis was a despicable operation that took money from members of the public for items that were not what they purported to be."Great work by Shared Regulatory Services has led to this prosecution, which ensures that no more people will fall victim to this company.ldquoI welcome the signicant sum Mr Payter has been told to repay, which reflects the amount of money he made from the operation.ldquoThis case should serve as a warning to others operating illegally within our community. The Council will actively look to protect our residents and will not hesitate to take actionwe find people are not operating within the parameters of the law. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: mcdonalds scrap popular items menu make way  new offerings
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFast food lovers will know, the UKrsquos most popular burger chain regularly updates its menu throughout the year with promotions to keep their offerings fresh.From this week, McDonaldrsquos has unveiled five new items that will be available to customers until mid-June.The new products will be part of the chains menu from May  to June  meaning you will only have a short time to sample their new offerings.One of the items making ais a firm favourite among McDonaldrsquos lovers, the Bacon Clubhouse Double.The burger consists of two % beef patties, two rashers of Beechwood smoked bacon, a slice of cheddar cheese, onions, tomato, lettuce, and sauce.Another item being added to the menu is the Chicken Deluxe Sandwich.A chicken option consisting of two crunchy Chicken Selects, Emmental cheese, lettuce, red onions, tomato relish, and mayonnaise. Both items will cost pound. each." alt"Penarth Times: Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. " class"editor-image"Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. Another item making ato the menu is the Cheese and Herb Melts. Priced at pound., the cheesy treats come in a pack of five and accompanied with a delicious tomato and herb sauce.McDonaldrsquos is also mixing it up with their McFlurryrsquos with Galaxy and Galaxy Caramel flavours making ato the menu.Both feature Galaxy chocolate chunks with either chocolate or caramel sauce and cost pound..Now that you have had the good news, to make way for the new items McDonaldrsquos is having to scrap a number of items that have proven popular with customers.One of which is the Big Tasty burger which was removed on May  alongside the Chicken BBQ Smokehouse burger.To make way for the Galaxy McFlurryrsquos, McDonaldrsquos has also revealed the Cadbury Cregraveme Egg and the Cadbury Caramel flavours are being scrapped.The items were reintroduced to the McDonaldrsquos menu in March when customers were warned they would only be available until May.However, with how often the menu changes it is likely customers will see them make ato the menu sometime in the future. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: senedd election  vaughan gething retains seat
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething at the count for the Senedd elections iltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgtn the House of Sportltspan classtruncate-full-screengt, Cardf today.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething with his son and we celebrating afterltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt winning Cardf Soultspan classtruncate-full-screengtth and Penarth during the count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething celebrating after winning Cardf Southltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt and Penarth during ltspan classtruncate-full-screengtthe count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentVAUGHAN Gething has retained his seat in the Senedd.Mr Gething, who has represented Cardf South and Penarth since , has secured his seat by a majority of more than , votes.The Labour representative received , votes."Im delighted with the result," he said."A really strong showing across Cardf South and Penarth. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labour hold ground north wales election counting continues
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityOnly one of Walesrsquo so-called red wall seats, the Vale of Clwyd, fell to the Welsh Conservatives, while Labour sources are also confident of unseating the former Plaid Cymru leader Leanne Wood in Rhondda.Changes to ensure social distancing at venues means counting for all constituencies may not finish on Friday, which would see the process being adjourned until Saturday morning.Some regional counts also look set to be pushed back to Saturday.Thank you to all of the brilliant Welsh Labour activists who have worked tirelessly over the last weeks and months. While we now wait for the results, you can be proud of everything wersquove achieved together.mdash Welsh LabourMay , At the start of the election campaign, polling suggested Labour was facing its worst ever result and was at risk of winning as few as  of the Seneddrsquos  seats, a loss of seven from .After voting polls closed at pm on Thursday, party sources said retaining all of its seats in the Senedd remained ldquoa massive challenge.But on Friday evening, confirmed results as well as indications from parties contesting seats across the country means Mark Drakefordrsquos party is confident of ending up just short of an outright majority once again.The First Minister said Labourrsquos performance reflected the ldquoreal enthusiasm he had encountered on doorsteps.ldquoI started this campaign answering questions as to why this was going to be Labourrsquos worst-ever result, a poll prediction of  seats, he said.ldquoThe campaign never felt like that to me. Wersquove had a fantastic and energetic campaign with hundreds of people involved and real enthusiasm on the doorstep, so that never seemed to me to genuinely reflect the mood here in Wales.Mr Drakeford said it was ldquotoo early to say whether results meant Labour could win an outright majority.     Walesrsquo health minister Vaughan Gething said Labour had fought hard to win back the trust of voters in North Wales.Wrexham, Clwyd South and Delyn, were all held despite being targeted by the Tories after they flipped them from Labour in the  general election." data-title"POLITICS Elections" data--holder"PA Graphics" data--notice"PA Graphics Press Association Images" data-credit"PA Graphics" data-usage-terms"" srcset"https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production eedadfbddcYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjIwNTAMjQw ..jpg w w, https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production eedadfbddcYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjIwNTAMjQw ..jpg w w, https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production eedadfbddcYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjIwNTAMjQw ..jpg w w" sizes" vw,vw,px, px"ldquoWersquove absolutely had to re-earn the trust of the people of Wales in every part of Wales. Wersquove taken nothing for granted, wersquove absolutely not been complacent, Mr Gething said.ldquoThe Tories put a lot of heavy artillery into North Wales. The Prime Minister visited several times, the Chancellor was there, Andrew RT Davies was there on regular occasions, and they launched their manesto in Wrexham.Mr Gething said indications of a stronger Labour result than was predicted could help the UK party following its Westminster by-election defeat in Hartlepool.Askedhe had a message for Sir Keir Starmer about the direction of the Labour Party should go in, Mr Gething said: ldquoThe message for all of us is keep on listening to what the public are saying.ldquoDonrsquot tell the public theyrsquore wrong when they vote, try to understand why theyrsquove chosen to vote in a dferent way. Listen and do the right things that are consistent with our values.ldquoYou canrsquot simply assume that people will continue to vote for you as a result of old tribal loyalty.Welsh Tory leader in the Senedd Andrew RT Davies said his partyrsquos taking of Vale of Clwyd from Labour was a ldquobrilliant result, but suggested traditional Labour voters who voted Tory in the  general election had now ldquocome home.Mr Davies told the PA news agency: ldquoIt does seem from other seats that have been declared in other parts of Wales that the Labour voters have come home to it after the, shall we say, Brexit election of .Labour may also find comfort that the Vale of Clwyd loss was only by a small margin, with Tory Gareth Davies receiving , votescompared to Labour Jason McLellanrsquos , .Labour sources also say they are confident of taking Rhondda from Plaid Cymru, which they lost to incumbent Leanne Wood at the  election.The final make-up of the next Senedd may not be confirmed until the weekendresults in some constituencies are close and recounts are called.No party has ever won an outright majority in Wales, meaning the party which has won the most seats will be expected to enter into talks with other parties or independent members in order to form the next Welsh Government..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Labour hold ground in North Wales as election counting continues article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: can go holiday
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityHere the PA news agency answers  key questions on what this means for holidaymakers:# INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL UPDATE #The ban on non-essential international travel will be removed on the th May and replaced with a traffic light system #This means it will no longer be illegal to travel abroad without a permitted reason pic bOIaJKcimdash Rt Hon Grant Shapps MPMay , ndash Why are the lists important They determine the quarantine and coronavirus testing requirements people will face when ing to England once the ban on overseas leisure travel is lted on May .ndash Why is everyone talking about the green list Travellers ing from a country on that list will not be need to quarantine, and will only be required to take one post-arrival test.ndash Sounds good. Whatrsquos on it It consists of Portugal, Gibraltar, Israel, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Brunei, Iceland and the Faroe Islands, plus several small remote islands which are British Overseas Territories." data-title"Israel" data--holder"PA Archive" data--notice"PA Archive PA Images" data-credit"Adam Davy" data-usage-terms"" srcset"https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production eefdebcfdebfbcYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjENjkODIy ..jpg w w, https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production eefdebcfdebfbcYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjENjkODIy ..jpg w w, https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production eefdebcfdebfbcYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjENjkODIy ..jpg w w" sizes" vw,vw,px, px"Beach volleyball on one of Tel Avivrsquos beaches ndash So I can go on holiday to anywhere on that list Not quite. Entry to Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Brunei and the Faroe Islands is severely restricted.ndash Where can I go Portugal plans to welcome UK tourists who have had a recent negative test, have recovered from the virus and therefore have antibodies, or had both doses of a vaccine.Gibraltar will not require UK visitors to be tested or vaccinated, whereas Israel will initially reopen its border on May  only to groups of foreign tourists who have had both jabs.None of these destinations will require arrivals to quarantine.##Portugal including the Azores and Madeira##Israel##Australia##New Zealand##Singapore##Iceland##Brunei##Faroe Islands##Gibraltar##Falkland Islandsmdash Rt Hon Grant Shapps MPMay , ndash What about the amber list That covers the most popular holiday destinations such as Spain, France, Italy and Greece.Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said ldquoyou should not be travelling to these places right nowndash WhatI go against that guidance People ing from amber countries must take two post-arrival tests.They are also required to self-isolate at home for  days, although they can reduce that timethey take an additional negative test on day-five.In addition to the above, the MALDIVES, NEPAL and TURKEY will be added to the Red List. Passengers arriving into England after am on th May MUST undertake a ten day stay in a managed quarantine hotel.More information below #https:t.co vhwHMEuvmdash Rt Hon Grant Shapps MPMay , ndash How about the red list Those ing from a red list country must stay in a quarantine hotel for  nights at a cost of pound,.ndash Will the lists change The lists can be amended at any time, but wholesale changes are not expected to occur until the situation is reviewed at a ldquocheckpoint on June .ndash How does the Government decide which countries are on each list There are four key tests that the Government will take into account when deciding how to categorise a country within the traffic light system.These include the percentage of the countryrsquos population to have been vaccinated, the rate of infection, the prevalence of iants of concern and the countryrsquos access to reliable scientic data and genomic sequencing.ndash What about vaccine passports Grant Shapps confirmed that people in England will be able to demonstrate they have had both doses of a vaccine through the NHS app.ndash Can people living in Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland go on a foreign holiday The devolved administrations have not set dates for the restart of overseas leisure travel, although announcements are expected in the coming days.Grant Shapps there was ldquoa large degree of agreement and cooperation in developing the system..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Where can I go on holiday  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce title: scottish labour one seat deputy leader increases majority
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMs Baillie won , votes, compared to , for the SNPrsquos Tony Giugliano.In , the Dumbarton seat went to Ms Baillie by just  votes, but on Friday she increased her majority to ,.Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar lost out to Nicola Sturgeon in Glasgow Southside but said he was pleased to increase his partyrsquos share of the vote in the constituency.Daniel Johnson held Edinburgh Southern on , votes to SNP candidate Catriona MacDonaldrsquos ,.But Martin Whitfield lost East Lothian ndash which had been won in  by the retiring MSP Iain Gray ndash to the SNPrsquos Paul McLennan.Mr Sarwar lost to the First Minister in his home constituency but is also a candidate on the regional list, which will be declared on Saturday.As results were announced at the Emirates Arena on Friday, Mr Sarwar won , votes to Ms Sturgeonrsquos ,.In , the First Minister won a total of , votes ndash with the Labour candidate winning , votes.Speaking to the PA news agency after the result, he said: ldquoIrsquom pleased that we doubled the actual number of votes that we got and we increased the share of our vote by %.ldquoI think you can see the immense progress we have made in the last  weeks.He said Labour was still on a journey to build a ldquocredible alternative to the SNP.Saying he welcomed the increased turnout, he added: ldquoIrsquom not one of those politicians who likes to calculate whether a higher turnout or a lower turnout is good or bad for their inidual political party.ldquoI think itrsquos good for democracy that as many people participate as possible.Discussing East Lothian, he said: ldquoItrsquos disappointing, therersquos no point in denying it.ldquoOf course Irsquom particularly disappointed for our amazing candidate Martin Whitfield.     Polls are now closed. I want to say thank you to my campaign team, our incredible candidates, activists, supporters and all across Scotland who took part in the democratic process.I am so proud of the positive and forward looking campaign we have ran, together. pic zYNcsELmdash Anas SarwarMay , ldquoBut again, look at where we were  weeks ago ndash we were at % in the opinion polls and coming fourth.ldquoEven my biggest critics can see that over the course of the last  weeks wersquove got the Labour Party back on the pitch.ldquoI think people can see that Irsquom a dferent kind of leader, trying to build a dferent kind of party, and together rebuild a dferent kind of country..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Scottish Labour down one seat but deputy leader increases majority article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labour claims extraordinary results welsh parliament election
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe party has exceeded expectations as counting for the Welsh Parliament election continues, having so far lost just one of its seats and taking Rhondda from Plaid Cymrursquos former leader Leanne Wood.Polling at the start of the campaign suggested Labour was facing its worst ever result and was at risk of winning as few as  of the Seneddrsquos  seats, a loss of seven from , though later polls suggested a stronger showing. vw,vw,px, px"After voting closed at pm on Thursday, party sources said retaining all of its seats in the Senedd remained ldquoa massive challenge.Commenting on the ldquoremarkable turnaround on Friday evening, a Labour spokesperson said: ldquoIt is increasingly clear that people across Wales have put their faith in Welsh Labour and Mark Drakeford to lead the next Welsh Government and lead Wales out of the pandemic.Health minister Vaughan Gething held his Cardf South and Penarth seat with , votes , a increase of , votes from , and said Labour and Mr Drakefordrsquos handling of the coronavirus pandemic was a ldquomajor factor in the partyrsquos results.He told the PA news agency: ldquoWersquove had to make le-changing choices that affected every single family in the country.ldquoThe pandemic has thrust the First Minister in the spotlight, and most people like what theyrsquove seen in the way hersquos handled the pandemic.ldquoWhat we now need to do is understand what that means for the future government for Wales, how we handle this next phase finishing up the pandemic response, and then the dficult task of recovery ndash one that I think wersquore in the best possible place for.Mr Drakeford said earlier on Friday that signs of a strong Labour performance reflected the ldquoreal enthusiasm he had encountered on doorsteps.     Labour are on  seats, the Tories on eight, and Plaid Cymru on five with two more constituency declarations to go, including Mr Drakefordrsquos Cardf West constituency.Labour said Plaid Cymru had ldquoimploded in losing its Rhondda seat to Labourrsquos Elizabeth Buffy Williams and failing to take target seats Llanelli and Aberconwy.Rhonddarsquos outgoing MS, Leanne Wood, told ITV Wales the result was ldquodisappointing, but said her party ran a ldquoclean and honest campaign.Labourrsquos strong results will minimise its reliance on other parties in order to form a government, with Plaid previously thought as the most likely to enter into a coalition with them were Labour some way short of a majority.Only one of Walesrsquo so-called red wall seats, the Vale of Clwyd, fell to the Welsh Conservatives.Wrexham, Clwyd South and Delyn, were all held despite being targeted by the Tories after they flipped them from Labour in the  general election.Welsh Tory leader in the Senedd Andrew RT Davies said his partyrsquos taking of Vale of Clwyd from Labour was a ldquobrilliant result, but suggested traditional Labour voters who voted Tory in the  general election had now ldquocome home.Mr Davies told the PA news agency: ldquoIt does seem from other seats that have been declared in other parts of Wales that the Labour voters have come home to it after the, shall we say, Brexit election of .The final make-up of the next Senedd will not be confirmed until the weekend with final regional results expected on Saturday..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga,
